header.title: A Complete Book of Magic Science

central_thesis: This grimoire presents a structured and detailed system for the evocation and constraint of spirits, focusing on precise ritual preparation, consecration of magical tools and spaces, and specific invocations aligned with planetary days to establish a working bond with supernatural entities for information and assistance.

structure_content.summary: The introduction contextualizes 'A Complete Book of Magic Science' within the grimoire tradition, discussing the common issues of authorial anonymity, fraudulence, and textual transmission. It highlights the work's relationship to 'The Secret Grimoire of Turiel' and establishes its provenance as a Frederick Hockley manuscript from the mid-19th century, noting differences and the significance of Hockley's transcription practices for preserving such texts.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part the First: The Observations, Preparations, Consecrations, Circles, & Pentacles to be used in Invocating.
structure_content.summary: This section details the extensive preparatory steps required before any spirit invocation. It includes instructions for personal purification (seven days of retirement, fasting from sunrise to sunset, morning prayers, washing), drawing the magic circle (9-foot diameter), making and consecrating essential magical equipment such as pentacles, lamens, a sword, ritual garments, and specific perfumes. It also provides an 'Exorcism of Fire' and outlines daily invocations tailored to the spirits of each day of the week, complete with unique characters and perfume recipes for the Lords of the Seven Planets.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part the Second: Containing Invocations, Conjurations, and Exorcisms of the Bond of Spirits.
structure_content.summary: This part focuses on the practical execution of conjurations and exorcisms. It begins with an 'Oration to be said when putting on the Vestures' to imbue the garments with righteousness. The subsequent prayers serve to invoke divine grace, purify the magician from sin, and request strength and courage to successfully call and communicate with spirits, ensuring their appearance and compliance without harm.

structure_content.chapter_title: Part the Third: Form of a Bond of Spirits Given by Turiel Messenger of the Spirits.
structure_content.summary: This concluding operative section outlines the direct interaction with invoked spirits, exemplified through a dialogue with Turiel, the Messenger of Jupiter. It includes the formal 'Interrogations' by the magician to confirm the spirit's identity and its willingness to comply, followed by the spirit's 'Oath' to appear and provide information. The section ends with the 'Licence to Depart' and 'Gloria Deo in Excelsis', marking the completion of the ritual.

The notes provide critical commentary, comparing variations between 'A Complete Book of Magic Science' (BoM) and 'The Grimoire of Turiel' (GoT). They clarify Latin passages, discuss transcription errors, and highlight differences in ritual instructions, diagrams, and spirit names. These notes are crucial for understanding the textual evolution and practical nuances of the grimoire tradition.

key_concepts.definition: A magical textbook containing instructions for summoning spirits or performing magical rituals, often with claims of ancient or divine origin and pseudonymous authorship.
A consecrated ritual space, typically drawn on the ground with a 9-foot diameter, designed to contain and protect the magician during spirit invocations and exorcisms.
Magical talismans, often inscribed with divine names and characters, worn or used in rituals to attract divine virtue, influence, and power, and to serve as a bond with spirits.
The act of ritually sanctifying objects, spaces, or persons through prayers and blessings, imbuing them with divine power and purity for magical operations.
The process of compelling and commanding spirits, often through the authority of divine names, to appear, obey, or depart, ensuring they do no harm and fulfill the magician's desires.

A system of magic that aligns rituals, invocations, and materials with the specific influences and spirits associated with each of the seven traditional planets (Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn) and their corresponding days of the week.
A formal agreement or oath established between the magician and an invoked spirit, whereby the spirit commits to appear and fulfill the magician's demands.

practical_system.description: The practical system is a ceremonial magic grimoire tradition, emphasizing extensive spiritual and physical purification, detailed preparation and consecration of ritual tools, and the precise invocation of planetary spirits to establish a working bond. It stresses devotion to the Abrahamic God as the ultimate source of power and authority, allowing the magician to command lesser spirits for specific requests.
tools: Planetary Perfumes (specific blends for each planet, often including animal components)
Planetary Characters/Sigils (specific designs for each planetary Lord)
Grimoire Text (for precise invocations and instructions)
Knowledge of Divine Names (e.g., Agla, Adonay, Tetragrammaton)
rituals: Seven-day spiritual and physical purification (retirement from company, sunrise-to-sunset fasting, morning prayers, washing).
Drawing and consecrating a 9-foot diameter magic circle.
Making and consecrating pentacles and lamens with divine names and characters.
Consecration of a ritual sword for protection and overcoming spiritual opposition.
Consecration of clean, pure ritual garments.
Preparation and consecration of specific planetary perfumes using various natural (and some animal) ingredients.
Exorcism of fire for ritual purity and divine praise.
Daily specific invocations for spirits aligned with the day's ruling planet, utilizing unique characters/sigils and perfume blends.
Formal orations and prayers before putting on vestments and commencing the main work.
Direct interrogations and commands to invoked spirits, culminating in a binding oath for future service.
Formal license to depart for the spirits after the work is complete.

relevant_quotes.text: Containing the method of constraining and exorcising spirits to appearance, the consecration of Magic Circles, and The Form of a Bond of Spirits.

Retire thyself seven days free from all company and fast and pray from sunrise to sunset. Rise every morning at seven of the clock and the three days previous to the work fast upon bread & water. Humble yourself before Almighty God. Watch and pray all night before the Work.

O Great God Who art the God of strength and fortitude and greatly to be feared, bless O Lord, this Instrument that it may be a terror unto the Enemy, and therewith I may fight with and overcome all phantasms and oppositions of the Enemy, through the influence and help of Thy most Holy Mighty Name, On, St. Agla, and in the Cross of Jesus Christ our only Lord. Amen.
Come, Heavenly Spirits who hast the effulgent rays of the Sun. Luminous Spirits who are ready to obey the power of the great Tetragrammaton, (אלחיב, חיים, נרולה, א')

I, Turiel, Messenger of the Spirits of Jupiter, appointed thereunto by the Creator of all things visible and invisible, do swear and promise, and plight my faith and troth unto thee in the presence, by, and before the Great Lord God of Heaven and the whole company of Heaven, and by all the Holy Names of God, do swear and bind myself unto thee, by all the contents of God's Sacred Writ, by the Incarnation, death and passion, resurrection, and glorious Ascension of Jesus Christ, by all the Holy Sacraments, by the Mercy of God, by the Glory and Eyes of Heaven, by the forgiveness of sin, and hope of eternal salvation, by the Great Day of Doom, by all the Angels and Archangels, Seraphim, Cherubim, Dominations, Thrones, Principalities, Powers, and Virtues, Patriarchs, Prophets, Saints, Martyrs, Innocents, and all others of the blessed and glorious Company of Heaven, and by all the sacred powers and virtues above rehearsed, and by whatever is holy and binding, thus do I swear now, and promise unto thee that I will appear, come and hasten unto thee, at all times and places, and in all hours, days, and minutes, from this time forward until thy life's end, whensoever thou shalt call me by my name, or by my Office, and will come unto thee in what form thou shalt desire, whether it be visibly or invisibly; I will answer all thy desires.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book is highly relevant to Western Esotericism as a key text within the grimoire tradition, specifically the Solomonic current. Its status as a Hockley manuscript provides direct insight into 19th-century occult scholarship and practices, bridging historical grimoires with modern ceremonial magic. The meticulous detail in preparation, consecration, and invocation reflects a profound commitment to ritual precision and spiritual purity. The comparative notes reveal the textual evolution and challenges in transmitting magical knowledge, offering valuable material for textual critics and practitioners seeking to understand the 'original' or 'most authentic' forms of these rituals.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of serious practitioners of ceremonial magic, particularly those interested in the Solomonic grimoire tradition and planetary magic. Additionally, scholars of Western Esotericism, occult historians, and textual critics will find immense value in its historical context, comparative analysis with other versions (GoT), and detailed descriptions of ritual mechanics and philosophy. It is not intended for a casual or beginner audience due to its technical nature and the inherent demands of its practical system.
